result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 62 Days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant David A Brown in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.   State requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation and sets sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on March 16, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant David A Brown in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chernin states that he just found out that his homicide trial in Milwaukee County will be commencing on Tuesday, December 6, 2016 and therefore is not available for trial.  State also requested an adjournment.  Court adjourns - but LAST adjournment that will be granted.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 16, 2017 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Dated 11/07/16, from the State to Judge Carter, requesting to adjourn jury trial scheduled for 12/06/16.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.

11/10/16,   Per Judge Carter: This is the second request to adjourn from State, both due to witness availability issues.  Case filed 4/15/15. Court will address at jury status date.

Defendant David A Brown in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chernin indicates this case still remains in a trial posture, however he believes the matter may resolve after further negotiations.   Court notes the letter from the State indicating the witness is not available.  Attorney Behm is requesting an adjournment of the trial and makes further statements to the Court regarding the late notice of the request and that the deputy is necessary to ID the defendant.  Attorney Chernin does not object to the request and is requesting the matter be rescheduled for jury trial.  Court sets.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 9:43 a.m.  Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court.   Defendant David A Brown did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fragoso does not know why Defendant does not appear today but states that his family told him they were going to try to retain private counsel.   Court issues a capias.  Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited.

Case re-called at 10:50 a.m..  Defendant now appears.  All other appearances remain the same.  Court quashes warrant and re-instates bail.  Attorney Fragoso requests an adjourned date for Defendant as Defendant is meeting with a private attorney today.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.
